channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Santorini on alert as tremors rattle Greek island
item.description: Authorities advise against gatherings in enclosed spaces following a flurry of seismic activity nearby.

item.title: Teenage girl killed in shark attack in Australia
item.description: The 17-year-old was attacked around 100m from shore of Woormin Beach, Australian media reports.

item.title: Musk says administration is on verge of shutting USAID
item.description: Elon Musk, the administration's billionaire adviser and Tesla CEO, says the administration is on the verge of shutting the U.S. Agency for Internation...

item.title: Friends say Army captain killed in midair collision was a ‘brilliant and fearless’ patriot
Forgotten for 138 years, a Black composer's magnum opus finds a stage
item.description: Morgiane , perhaps the oldest opera by a Black American, finally receives its full public performance, shedding light on the forgotten heyday of opera...

item.title: Demonstrators block 101 Freeway during protest against ICE raids
item.description: A protest in downtown L.A. protest against the immigration policies of President Trump moved onto the 101 Freeway.

item.title: Mexico calls U.S. cartel alliance claim "slander," vows tariff retaliation
item.description: "If there is such an alliance anywhere, it is in the U.S. gun shops that sell high-powered weapons to these criminal groups," Mexican President Claudi...

item.title: How younger generations keep the folk art of lion dancing alive in LA
item.description: At the East Wind Foundation, in the heart of Los Angeles' Chinatown, young people dedicate their after-school hours and weekends to practice the tradi...

item.title: Mayor says 5 injured in fatal Philadelphia plane crash remain hospitalized, 3 in critical condition
Car bomb blast in northern Syria kills 15 agricultural workers
item.description: Fourteen women were among those killed in the attack outside Manbij, the Syria Civil Defence says.

item.title: Spain football kiss 'stained' World Cup win, player tells trial
item.description: Luis Rubiales went on trial in Madrid on Monday over the kiss, accused of sexual assault and coercion.

item.title: Barbie Hsu, star of popular drama "Meteor Garden," dies at age 48
item.description: Barbie Hsu, better known as "Da S" which means "Big S," caught the flu when she visited Japan with her family during the Lunar New Year, according to ...

item.title: Trump threatens to cut funding for South Africa over land policy
item.description: South Africa last month passed a law allowing the seizure of land under certain circumstances.

item.title: Two years after derailment, toxic chemicals still roll through East Palestine
item.description: Two years after derailment, toxic chemicals still roll through East Palestine

item.title: Officials say remains of 55 of 67 victims of midair collision have been recovered and identified
item.description: Authorities say they have recovered the remains of 55 of the 67 people killed in the deadliest U.S. air disaster since 2001. Washington, D.C.

item.title: How corporate America got DEI wrong
item.description: President Trump is accelerating the attacks on diversity-in-business programs. But DEI experts say this may be the wakeup call big companies need.

item.title: Shark kills girl in Australia in 3rd fatal attack in just over 5 weeks
item.description: Paramedics rushed to treat the teenager who was swimming off a beach in Queensland, but say she succumbed to serious injuries to her upper body.

item.title: Vagus nerve stimulation may tame autoimmune diseases
item.description: The next big advance in treating diseases like rheumatoid arthritis could be tiny pulses of electricity delivered to the vagus nerve.
